column4: Anyone know how to see a list of installated programs on ubuntu 5.10 server?
installed* even
use this command -- dpkg --get-selections > installed-software
running ubuntu server.
it will still work.
I want to see the installed packages on my server, just have no idea of how to see it.
oh, sorry.
didnt seem to work
did you look at the list afterwards?  dpkg --get-selections outputs the installed packages to a file called "installed-software".  Then just "cat installed-software | less" to read it
got no list :p
The whole thing into one line would look like : dpkg --get-selections > installed-software && cat installed-software | less
oh, thanks.
Is there something I could remove that's not needed for a server, that might eat cpu/ram or such P0ldy ?

well, sure, but it obviously depends on what you're using the server for.  Naturally you won't need an x-server if you have one, or alsa, ...I mean, you can uninstall anything you aren't using... that'd slim it down
gonna use it for game servers only, anything I could remove thats not needed? running 5.10 breezy

I'm no expert on game servers and I don't know what you've got installed already, but you could look at removing services running in the background by default, like cups (print service) or Apache if you aren't running a web server (again, might be required for a gaming server, I've never set one up)
everything I need is screen,ssh - that's all.
can we talk in private or such?
check out this thread for getting rid of unneccessary services http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=89491
as Im gonna ghost this installation on 10 other servers tomorrow, need this done asap :(
probably best just to keep it in the chat since there are other more knowledgable people here that could probably chime in their two cents
plus, I'm leaving for a bit
